info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 03 at 1:16PM PST until January 04 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 3000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing and drifting snow ongoing. Total new snow accumulations of 8 to 15 inches with wind gusts 45 to 65 mph at times, especially over the higher terrain and in areas open to winds from the south and southwest. * WHERE...All areas, especially Crater Lake,Interstate 5 at Siskiyou Summit, and Highways 62, 138, 140, and 97. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Snow is likely to begin around 4 AM PST Monday morning. Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow and blowing snow will continue through today, but diminish in intensity overnight. Wind and snow will increase again Tuesday morning and persist into the evening. Blizzard-like conditions are likely. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
